lines.text: You don't have to be great. Not everybody can be great.
What do you think would happen if everyone in this world tried to do two things at the same time?

I know who I'd like to be. I'd like to be a great musician. Music is the only time I feel like I'm me, you know, not like my parents little boy or some kid going to school. I mean, I feel like a whole person. You understand?
I've heard her say hello before. Plenty of times. Never hit me as anything special.
You know, it's funny. My dad used to be the same as me when he was a kid. He loved horses. He did the same job I used to do.
Yeah?
Yeah. But now... Now he doesn't have time for that kind of stuff. He's too busy.

[having just made love for the first time]
What are you thinking about?
Nothing really.
Is anything wrong?
No. I'm just wispy.
Wispy? What's that?
I don't know. It's a happy kind of... quiet... something like that.
Are ya happy?
Yes. Are you?
Yeah. Yeah, I'm kind of - wispy.
Don't make fun.
Jeremy, I got where I am in my job by working hard and by concentrating, and you have to do the same. You have to concentrate, too.
But, Dad, I get straight A's, except for one B.

[sighs]
That's beside the point.
On the other hand, Marty says this room cries for avocado.
It's hard making friends.
It's something you just have to work at, like everything else in life, you know?
